author: DistroTube
description:
The 'pwd' command prints the current working directory. In other words, it prints the directory that you're currently in.

- Print the current directory:
pwd

- Print the current directory "logical" path (default behavior):
pwd -L

- Print the current directory "phsyical" path, with symlinks resolved:
pwd -P

title: 'pwd' - print the working directory - Video Man Pages

author: DistroTube
description:
The 'whoami' command does one thing: it prints the effective username. In other words, it prints the user that you're currently logged in as.

- Print currently logged username:
whoami

- Print the username after a change in user:
sudo whoami
